div.a: Governor Sisolak announces Stay at Home directive, extends closure date to the end of April

span.p: Carson City, NV — Today, Nevada Gov. Steve Sisolak formally issued a “Stay at Home” directive for Nevadans and extended the nonessential business, gaming and school closures and all other directives issued under the Emergency Declaration to April 30, 2020.

The governor has been asking Nevadans to “Stay Home for Nevada” since March 17 and has taken multiple steps since declaring a state of emergency on March 12 to protect Nevadans and encourage them to stay home and help flatten the curve. This directive reinforces the Governor’s earlier advisory for Nevadans to stay home and will go into effect at midnight on April 1, 2020.

a.title: Click to read more about: Governor Sisolak announces Stay at Home directive, extends closure date to the end of April

div.a: Read More about Governor Sisolak announces Stay at Home directive, extends closure date to the end of April
PCSD offers Meal Service to students during COVID-19 Shutdown

span.p: Dear Pershing County School District Parents,

Pershing County School District is pleased to announce that as of 2:20 p.m. today our Foodservice Department received permission from the Nevada Department of Agriculture that we can offer some meals to our students during this shutdown. Meal Service will be provided Monday thru Thursday beginning on Wednesday, March 18, 2020 thru April 9th. We will then resume food service after spring break on April 20th until the school closure is lifted.

a.title: Click to read more about: PCSD offers Meal Service to students during COVID-19 Shutdown

div.a: Read More about PCSD offers Meal Service to students during COVID-19 Shutdown

span.p: The Pershing County School District Board of Trustees and District Leadership share our community’s concerns about a possible outbreak of the COVID-19 Virus. We are collaborating with the Health Officials from Pershing County, The State of Nevada, and Federal Government to determine the best course of action to protect our students and staff members and ensure the educational needs of our students are met.
